summary: This is an email chain from September 2021 between a U.S. Attorney's Office prosecutor and Amazon's legal counsel regarding a subpoena (reference CRIM1071168) issued to Amazon. The correspondence involves scheduling a call to discuss questions about the subpoena, indicating an ongoing investigation or legal proceeding requiring information from Amazon.

persons.name: Ben Langner
persons.role: Senior Corporate Counsel, Government & Regulatory Litigation at Amazon.com Inc.
persons.context: Amazon's legal counsel corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a subpoena. He is scheduling a call to discuss questions about the subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Goldberg
persons.context: Recipient of the initial email from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding questions about an Amazon subpoena. Copied on the scheduling correspondence.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.role: Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: The prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office who initiated contact with Amazon's counsel to ask follow-up questions about a subpoena and who sent the finalized subpoena document.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Andrew) is corresponding with corporate counsel (Langner) regarding a subpoena issued to Amazon as part of an investigation or legal proceeding.
Prosecutor (Andrew) initially contacted legal counsel (Goldberg) with questions about an Amazon subpoena.
Both are legal counsel for Amazon, copied on the same correspondence regarding the government subpoena.

events.title: Call between SDNY and Amazon counsel
events.description: A call took place on Friday, September 24, 2021, between the U.S. Attorney's Office (Andrew) and Amazon's counsel (Ben Langner) to discuss a subpoena.

events.title: Subpoena finalized and sent
events.description: The subpoena discussed in the prior call was finalized and attached to an email sent by the U.S. Attorney's Office to Amazon's counsel.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively issuing and following up on a subpoena (CRIM1071168) to Amazon.com Inc. in September 2021.
The subpoena appears related to a criminal investigation or proceeding, as indicated by the 'CRIM' reference number and the involvement of an Assistant U.S. Attorney.
The correspondence shows ongoing cooperation and communication between federal prosecutors and Amazon's legal team regarding the information request.
The document is a routine procedural email chain focused on scheduling and document transmission, not containing substantive details about the underlying case.
